quotes: During his tenure as European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid from 2004 to 2009
During his tenure as European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid from 2004 to 2009
The European Commission, under Michel's oversight, allocated an additional €16 million in September 2006 specifically to bolster the electoral process
Michel endorsed the extension of the DRC's transitional government by six months in June 2005
He also facilitated the launch of the European Union Police Mission (EUPOL DRC) in 2005
In October 2008, he conducted regional talks in Nairobi and announced €4 million in immediate humanitarian aid
He visited North Kivu in December 2008 to evaluate the crisis firsthand
welcoming joint operations in early 2009 that integrated former insurgents into the Congolese army
Humanitarian and justice initiatives under Michel included €25 million committed in June 2006 for judicial system restoration
The Commission also co-launched the 2006 Humanitarian Action Plan for DRC
In July 2006, the EU allocated €5 million

roles.title: European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid
quotes: During his tenure as European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid from 2004 to 2009
During his tenure as European Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid from 2004 to 2009
Louis Michel prioritized support for the Democratic Republic of the Congo's (DRC) transition to democracy
Michel endorsed the extension of the DRC's transitional government by six months in June 2005
aiming to reform the Congolese security sector
Michel engaged in extensive shuttle diplomacy to address eastern DRC conflicts
for displaced populations in North Kivu
He visited North Kivu in December 2008 to evaluate the crisis firsthand
Michel viewed Rwanda's military involvement in disarming DRC rebels as a 'tangible sign of normalization'
The Commission also co-launched the 2006 Humanitarian Action Plan for DRC
In October 2008, he conducted regional talks in Nairobi and announced €4 million in immediate humanitarian aid
for displaced populations in North Kivu
He visited North Kivu in December 2008 to evaluate the crisis firsthand
Michel viewed Rwanda's military involvement in disarming DRC rebels as a 'tangible sign of normalization'
Louis Michel focused primarily on coordinating the EU's humanitarian response to the 2006 Israel-Hezbollah War in Lebanon
